noun.description: An opaque white fluid rich in fat and protein, secreted by female mammals for the nourishment of their young.
examples: a healthy mother will produce enough milk for her baby

verb.description: Draw milk from (a cow or other animal), either by hand or mechanically.
Exploit or defraud (someone), typically by taking regular small amounts of money over a period of time.
examples: he had milked his grandmother dry of all her money

phrases: I will refer to goats in milk and to milking goats to reflect the distinction.
The champion Friesian heifer in milk saw an honour awarded to Aidan Foody from Ardagh.
The data were adjusted for previous lactation milk yield and days in milk at last test day.
I guess it's no use crying over spilt milk, but I do remember feeling a sense of disappointment as these features were dropped from Vista.
It's obviously very disappointing when you lose your captain and inspiration but it's no use crying over spilt milk, said Wigan coach Dennis Betts.
origin: Old English milc, milcian, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch melk and German Milch, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin mulgere and Greek amelgein to milk.
